title: Simple Addition on the Soroban: Your Child's First Calculations
description: Adding on the soroban is intuitive once you see it. Start with these simple examples your child can master in one session.

content.intro: Addition on the soroban is beautifully simple: just move beads toward the beam. No carrying, no borrowing – at least not at first. Here's how to introduce basic addition.

sections.text: To ADD: Move beads TOWARD the beam. Lower beads go UP (using thumb). Upper bead goes DOWN (using index finger).

items: **Step 1:** Set 2 (push 2 lower beads up to beam)
**Step 3:** Read the answer: 5 beads total at beam = 5

sections.text: What if you have 4 and need to add 1, but there's no more lower beads?

items: **Step 3:** Exchange: Push all 4 lower beads DOWN, push upper bead DOWN

sections.text: 4 + 1 = 5. Clear four, add five. This is the first 'complement' technique – it becomes second nature with practice.

items: 5 + 2 = 7 (start with upper bead down, add lower beads)
**Start small:** Single digits only at first
**Celebrate wins:** Every correct answer builds confidence

faq.question: What if my child uses fingers to count the beads?
faq.answer: Totally fine at first! They'll naturally stop as they get faster. Don't discourage it early on.

faq.question: Should we clear the soroban between problems?
faq.answer: Yes. Reset all beads away from the beam before each new problem. This builds good habits.

faq.question: How many problems per session?
faq.answer: 5-10 problems is plenty for beginners. End before frustration sets in. Short positive sessions beat long exhausting ones.

cta.text: Our app guides through addition step by step with instant feedback.
